usefulItems: rolling pin, large frying pan, tea towel, hob
title: Beef With Lemon Grass (Kuruma Iraichchi) And Coconut Roti

ingredients.content: 350 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
½ - 1 tsp fine sea salt, to taste
2 Tbsp oil, plus extra for frying
750 g beef chuck steak, boneless, diced (approx. 3 cm)
2 - 4 tsp ground black pepper, to taste
1 cm fresh root ginger, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
3 - 5 bird's eye chillies, fresh, deseeded if preferred
2 pandan leaves, tied in a knot
1 lime, cut in wedges for serving

preparations.content: Place flour, coconut, water, salt and oil in mixing bowl then mix <b>6 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Knead <b>1 min/<b>. Transfer dough to a lightly floured work surface (see tips). Divide dough into 12 pieces and use a rolling pin to flatten into round rotis (approx. Ø 12 cm).

Place a large frying pan over a medium heat and add oil. Place 1 roti in hot frying pan and fry until golden (approx. 2-3 minutes on each side). Transfer to a plate and cover with a tea towel to keep warm. Repeat with remaining roti. Cover to keep warm and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in beef. Add salt and pepper then combine until meat is evenly coated. Set bowl aside.
Place coriander in mixing bowl and, without measuring cup, toast <b>2 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>. Transfer to bowl with beef and stir to combine. Set bowl aside.
Place cumin and fennel seeds in mixing bowl then, without measuring cup, toast <b>1 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.
Place garlic, ginger and chillies in mixing bowl then chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add onions and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add turmeric, curry leaves, pandan leaves, vinegar, lemon grass, tomato puree, coconut cream and reserved beef then cook <b>8 min/Varoma//speed <b>.
With simmering basket in place of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid, cook <b>50 min/90°C//speed <b>.

Add reserved toasted spice mixture and, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid, cook <b>10 min/Varoma//speed <b>, until sauce has thickened. Serve warm with coconut roti and lime wedges.

hintsAndTricks: You can purchase fresh coconut at most supermarkets or fruit and vegetable stores.
For a milder curry, reduce the number of chillies and deseed before using.

To save time, prepare coconut roti up to <b>step 2<b> and set aside, then continue with recipe. Fry roti in <b>step 9<b> when Kuruma Iraichchi is cooking. Cover to keep warm and set aside until Kuruma iraichchi is ready to serve.
Coconut roti can be prepared a day ahead and reheated in a warm oven before serving.
To save time, use shop-bought roti and start recipe at <b>step 4.<b>
